titleStmt.title: No power but of God, and yet a power in every creature, or, A word in season, to all men not void of grace, or deprived of reason wherein is held forth that the Almighty God is not wanting to us in impowering of us, but we are wanting to him, in not improving our talent for him ... / by Robert Purnel.
titleStmt.author: Purnell, Robert, d. 1666.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Samuel Newton, dwelling in Wine-street in Bristol,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: dark, tightly bound with some loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
